Note.Content: MT בְּיַד־גְּדַלְיָהוּ NJPS "in the affair of Gedaliah" | HOTTP-C בֹּור גְּדַלְיָהוּ | NIV ESV "along with Gedaliah" | LXX "φρέαρ μέγα" RSV NRSV "large cistern" = בֹּור גָּדֹול REB GNT "large one" | CEV omit
NJPS NRSV REB CEV "monument" = [1nn] | RSV ESV "power" NIV GNT "control" = [1y]
RSV NJPS NRSV REB ESV "monument" = [1nn] | NIV GNT CEV "control" = [1y]
NIV NJPS GNT CEV ESV "(war) club" | NJB "javelin" | REB "throwing-stick" | RSV NRSV "handpike"

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
literally: between (one's) hands; hence: = part of the human body, especially from the shoulders to the bottom, either front or back
literally: weak of hands; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event
literally: (one's) hands are weak; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event
literally: to make (someone's) hands weak; hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to lack the courage to perform a certain event
literally: hand; hence: = part of an object extending out in a certain direction, ◄ similar to function of the body's hand or arm

literally: to drag out (one's) hand (with someone); hence, possibly: = action by which humans associate with other humans, ◄ described with the image of someone stretching out one's hand to someone else asking that person to join in
literally: to put (one's) hand with (someone else); hence: = action by which humans associate with other humans

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise
= literally: (one's) hands are strong; hence: = state in which humans have the confidence to perform a certain event
literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which human help other humans to find the courage to perform a certain event
literally: to lay hands (on someone); hence: = action by which humans seize other humans and take control of them
literally: to lift up (one's) hand); hence: = action by which deities get involved in an event after a time of inaction

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up (one's) hand > to act

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to weaken (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans or supernatural beings stop engaging in a certain activity
literally: to turn (one's) hand from (an event); hence: = action by which humans and deities purposefully refrain from engaing in a particular event
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence, possibly: = state in which something is done because of another matter relating to a particular person
literally: to cause to happen to (someone's) hand; hence: = causative process by which deities cause or allow something to happen to somebody
literally: to grasp (someone) by the hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities offer assistance to (other) humans
literally: (one's) hand is with (someone else); hence: = action by which humans or deities offer assistance to (other) humans
literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state of carrying an object physically in one's hand or as part of one's luggage

Glosses.Gloss: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: under (one's) hand; hence: = state in which humans have an object available to share with or give to other humans
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
literally: according to the hand(s) (of someone); hence: = state in which something takes place under the authority of someone else
literally: to appoint (someone) over the hands (of an activity); hence: = state in which someone has the authority over a certain activity
literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state in which an event is about to take place
literally: (someone's) hand; hence: = state in which humans own a particular object
literally: to cleave to (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans take possession of an object that they carry or come across, without having the authority to do so
literally: (someone's) hand; = state in which humans bear the responsibility for a certain situation
literally: (one's) hand wavers; hence: = state in which humans are unable to provide for themselves
literally: to shut (one's) hand; hence: = state in which humans are unwilling to help out other humans with money or goods
literally: to open (one's) hand; hence: = state in which humans are very willing to help out other humans with money or goods
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
literally: to bring (one's) hand to (one's) mouth; hence: = action by which humans eat something
literally: to lay (one's) hand on (two parties); hence: = causative action by which humans resolve a conflict between two parties
literally: wide of hands; hence: = state in which a certain object has a relatively large distance from side to side
literally: idleness of hands; hence: = state in which humans avoid activity

literally: hand; hence: = a pillar-like object made out of rock, possibly with a hand engraved upon it (as has been found on other ancient monuments, as a symbol of power or of prayer) ► set up in honor or memorial of someone (known ancient ones are in honor of a king or god)
literally: hand; hence: = pertaining to the location to the left or right of an object ◄ analogous to the location of someone's hands or arms
literally: to the side (of someone or something); hence: = state in which humans are available to provide help and assistance for the benefit of a person or place
literally: hands; hence: = more or less equal portions
literally: by hand; hence: = process by which a quantity increases in small increments
literally: to fill (someone's) hand; hence: = causative action by which humans ordain other humans to the office of priest or a similar role
literally: to fill the hands (of an object); hence: = causative action by where humans cause objects to be ready to be in the presence of a deity by going through special rituals
literally: to pour water on (someone's) hands; hence: = state in which humans are serving other humans in the position of assistant
literally: hand; hence: = a space designated for a certain purpose
literally: to lay (one's) hand on (one's) mouth; hence: = action by which humans purposefully refrain from speaking up
literally: to send out (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans straighten their arm in a certain direction
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans openly show resistance to someone else
literally: (to do something with) raised hand; hence: = state in which humans or deities perform an action with confidence
literally: to raise (one's) hand (to do something); hence: = action by which humans take a conscious decision to perform a certain event

Glosses.Gloss: to lift a hand (to do something)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (to do something); hence: = action by which humans take a conscious decision to perform a certain event

Glosses.Gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand > to lift a hand (to do something)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to stretch out (one's) hands (to someone); hence: = action by which humans give generously to someone else
literally: to wave (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
literally: waving of (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which deities engage in an act of violence against humans
literally: to lift up (one's) hands (against someone); hence: = action by which humans engage in an act of violence against other humans

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up (one's) hand (against someone else)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to cause (one's) hands to be high (against someone); hence: = action by which humans engage in an act of violence against other humans

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up (one's) hand (against someone else)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to turn (one's) hand against (someone else); hence: = action by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans

Glosses.Gloss: to lay (one's) hands (on someone or something)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to give (one's) hand (to someone); hence: = action by which humans accept the authority of other humans, or of a deity
literally: to stretch out (one's) hands (in order to take something); hence: = action by which humans take the possessions of other humans against their will
literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (on something); hence: = action by which humans take possession of objects belonging to someone else
literally: (one's) hand finds enough (to do something); hence: = state in which someone has sufficient resources to carry out a certain task
literally: (one's) hand touches enough (to do something); hence: = state in which someone has sufficient resources to carry out a certain task
literally: (one's) hand catches up (with something); hence: = state in which someone has sufficient resources to carry out a certain task
= object given in pledge

literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which deities make a solemn promise, invoking themselves as a witness by lack of a higher power, which, in the case of humans, is usually done while raising one's hand
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans make a solemn promise, often invoking a higher power as a witness, which is usually done while raising one's hand
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
literally: short (of hand); hence: = state in which humans lack the power to perform a certain event
literally: hand; hence: = a handheld tool or implement of wood or stone
literally: hand to hand; hence: = state in which the truth of a statement is confirmed
literally: to turn (one's) hand(s); hence: = causative action by which a charioteer causes his vehicle to turn around giving a firm pull on the reins of the horse
literally: to give (one's) hand (in pledge); hence: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to do something

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a short wooden rod used for striking the enemy in hand-to-hand combat; it could be held with one hand and was used to strike the enemy on all parts of his body, particularly where he was unprotected by armor; possibly fitted with a heavy head made of stone or metal
literally: as the hand of a king; hence: = a state in which something is done without holding back as can be expected from a king
